column1: Smoque BBQ////-The other sauce (is it called Memphis?) is what I usually go for. This is what uppity food connoisseurs hate
column2: and what most midwesterners love: A sauce that is thick
column5: peppery flavors. People say that this stuff masks the BBQ
column6: but I would beg to differ: Is it not possible that creating the perfect BBQ sauce to complement your meat is just as high an art as creating a good piece of BBQ-ed meat? All I know is that when I lather my brisket in this stuff
column7: I taste both the meat and the sauce
column8: and it is a match made in heaven.
